content: When I launch code under editor/code and press F5, the npm watch seems to be inhibiting the launching of the new extension debugging window, and I need to press Ctrl-C in the terminal tab to get it going. I'm also unable to stop at any breakpoints in .ts files. Any ideas on how to fix these issues?
@Zheyu Shen no, I haven't looked into TS extension for a long time. But the last time I did this, there weren't any npm watch there? Perhaps you need to just disable npm watch?
Maybe it's related to the new bundling?
Maybe. I also need to run npm run compile each time when I debug...
